{"id":1087336728,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1698646143,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"199 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1087336728/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Double a Number Represented as a Linked List","memory":"122.7 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode *next;\n *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    // Using a Stack of node pointers for reversal\n    ListNode* doubleIt(ListNode* head) {\n        stack<ListNode*> nodeStack; // Storing the node pointers directly in the stack\n        ListNode* temp=head;\n        while(temp) {\n            nodeStack.push(temp);\n            temp=temp->next;\n        }\n        int carry=0;\n        while(!nodeStack.empty()) {\n            ListNode* node=nodeStack.top();\n            node->val*=2;\n            node->val+=carry;\n            if(node->val/10==0) carry=0;\n            else {\n                carry=node->val/10;\n                node->val=node->val%10;\n            }\n            nodeStack.pop();\n        }\n        if(carry) {\n            ListNode* newNode=new ListNode(carry);\n            newNode->next=head;\n            head=newNode;\n        }\n        return head;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"double-a-number-represented-as-a-linked-list","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
